intro: Dendropanax blakeanus, commonly known as the New Zealand tree fern, is a species native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and large, feathery fronds. The plant grows in a variety of habitats, including forests and wetlands, and can reach heights of up to 10 meters. Its reproductive structures include spore-bearing cones, and it plays a significant ecological role in its native environment. The plant is also valued for its ornamental appeal and has been introduced to other parts of the world.
